verses.text: 這些事以後，主又另外指派了七十二個人（「七十二個人」有些抄本作「七十個人」），差遣他們兩個兩個地，在他前面，到他自己將要到的各城各地去。

words.note: Capitalized for 'the Lord' (God/Jesus)

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「莊稼多，工人少，所以你們應當求莊稼的主，派工人出去收他的莊稼。

words.note: Here refers to God/Jesus as the owner of the harvest.

verses.text: 你們去吧！我差你們去，如同羊羔進入狼群。

words.note: Indicates a suggestion or command.
Often used symbolically in the Bible.

verses.text: 不要帶錢囊，不要帶口袋，不要帶鞋，不要在路上問候人。

words.note: An older term for a money pouch.

verses.text: 無論進哪一家，先說：『願平安歸與這家！』

words.note: Used in biblical blessings for well-being.
A more formal, often biblical, expression.

verses.text: 那裡若有配得平安的人（「配得平安的人」原文作「平安之子」），你們的平安就必臨到他，不然，就歸給你們。

words.definition: to be worthy of, to deserve

words.note: Refers to spiritual peace or well-being.

words.definition: to be, to act as, to mean

words.note: Literary equivalent of '的', common in older translations.
Often used for spiritual or divine visitation.

words.definition: to return to, to revert to

verses.text: 你們要住在那家，吃喝他們所供給的，因為作工的理當得工資；不必從這家搬到那家。

words.note: Used to form a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase.

verses.text: 無論進哪一城，人若接待你們，擺上甚麼，就吃甚麼。

words.note: Implies offering food or provisions.

verses.text: 要醫治城中的病人，對他們宣講：『 神的國臨近你們了。』

words.note: Refers to the divine Being.
Specifically refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven.
Used in the context of the Kingdom of God's arrival.

verses.text: 無論進哪一城，人若不接待你們，你們就出來到街上，說：
『連你們城裡那黏在我們腳上的塵土，我們也要當著你們擦去。雖然這樣，你們應該知道： 神的國臨近了！』

words.note: A reverent space often precedes 神 in biblical texts.
Often refers to 'Kingdom of God/Heaven' in biblical context.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，當那日，所多瑪所受的，比那城所受的還輕呢。

words.note: Used to form a noun phrase from a verb.
Forms a noun phrase from '所受' meaning 'what was suffered'.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb.
Forms a noun phrase from '所受' meaning 'what was suffered'.
Expresses emphasis, surprise, or curiosity.

verses.text: 「哥拉遜啊，你有禍了！伯賽大啊，你有禍了！因為在你們那裡行過的神蹟，如果行在推羅和西頓，他們早已披麻蒙灰，坐在地上悔改了。

words.note: Often used in biblical 'woe to you' phrases.
Often used in biblical 'woe to you' phrases.
Lit. 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.
An ancient Near Eastern custom of mourning and repentance.
Primarily used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 在審判的時候，推羅和西頓所受的，比你們所受的還輕呢。

words.note: Often refers to divine judgment in religious texts.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb.
Forms a noun phrase from '所受' meaning 'what was suffered'.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb.
Forms a noun phrase from '所受' meaning 'what was suffered'.
Expresses emphasis, surprise, or curiosity.

verses.text: 還有你，迦百農啊！你會被高舉到天上嗎？你必降到陰間。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for exalting God or a person.
In religious context, refers to God's dwelling place.
Refers to the realm of the dead in biblical and ancient thought.

verses.text: 聽從你們的，就是聽從我；棄絕你們的，就是棄絕我；棄絕我的，就是棄絕那差我來的。」

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for rejecting faith or people.
Common in biblical contexts for rejecting faith or people.
Common in biblical contexts for rejecting faith or people.
Common in biblical contexts for rejecting faith or people.

verses.text: 那七十二個人歡歡喜喜地回來，說：「主啊，因你的名，連鬼也服了我們。」

words.note: Reduplicated form for emphasis on joy.
Used for God/Jesus in Christian contexts.
In biblical contexts, 'name' often implies authority or character.
Refers to evil spirits or demons in Christian theology.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我看見撒但，像閃電一樣從天墜落。

words.note: More literary than '掉落'.

verses.text: 我已經給你們權柄，去踐踏蛇和蠍子，勝過仇敵的一切能力。絕對沒有甚麼能傷害你們了。

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts.
More formal or literary than '踩'.
More formal/literary than '敵人'.

verses.text: 然而不要因為鬼服了你們就歡喜，卻要因為你們的名字記錄在天上而歡喜。」

words.note: Connects clauses, often introducing a contrasting idea.
Refers to evil spirits or demons in Christian theology.
In biblical contexts, 'name' often implies identity and destiny.
Refers to the heavenly realm, the abode of God.
Connects clauses, indicating consequence or progression.

verses.text: 就在這時候，耶穌因聖靈而歡樂，說：「父啊，天地的主，我讚美你，因為你把這些事向智慧和聰明的人隱藏起來，卻向嬰孩顯明。父啊，是的，這就是你的美意。

words.note: Here used as a verb.
Exclamation 'O Father!'
Commonly used for God in the Bible.
Exclamation 'O Father!'
Refers to God's benevolent will or purpose.

verses.text: 我父已經把一切交給我；除了父沒有人知道子是誰，除了子和子所願意啟示的人，也沒有人知道父是誰。」

words.note: Referring to God the Father.
Referring to God the Father.
Referring to Jesus as the Son of God.
Referring to Jesus as the Son of God.
Referring to Jesus as the Son of God.
Referring to God the Father.

verses.text: 耶穌轉過身來，悄悄地對門徒說：「看見你們所看見的，那眼睛有福了！

words.note: Lit. 'have blessing'.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，曾經有許多先知和君王，想看你們所看見的，卻沒有看到；想聽你們所聽見的，卻沒有聽到。」

words.note: Lit. 'first to know'.
見 as a resultative complement.

verses.text: 有一個律法師起來試探耶穌，說：「老師，我應該作甚麼，才可以承受永生呢？」

words.note: Refers to an expert in Mosaic Law.
Often implies malicious testing in biblical context.
Commonly used for inheriting salvation/life in the Bible.

verses.heading: The Parable of the Good Samaritan

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「律法上寫的是甚麼？你怎麼念的呢？」

words.note: Indicates scope or location, similar to 'in the law'
Forms a nominalized phrase 'that which is written'
Short for 怎麼
Forms '怎麼' (how)
Used to emphasize the action or manner

verses.text: 他回答：「你要全心、全性、全力、全意愛主你的 神，並且要愛鄰舍如同自己。」

words.note: Functions adverbially, meaning 'with one's whole heart'
Functions adverbially, meaning 'with one's whole soul'
Functions adverbially, meaning 'with one's whole strength'
Functions adverbially, meaning 'with one's whole mind'
A title for God or Christ
The space is a stylistic convention in some Chinese Bibles

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你答得對，你這樣行，就必得生命。」

words.note: Connects verb/adjective with a complement describing result/extent

verses.text: 那人想證明自己有理，就對耶穌說：「誰是我的鄰舍呢？」
耶穌回答：「有一個人從耶路撒冷下耶利哥去，落在強盜手中。他們剝去他的衣服，把他打得半死，撇下他一個人就走了。

words.note: Combined with '下' to indicate movement away
Forms '手中' (in one's hands)
Indicates the following noun is the direct object
Connects verb with a complement describing result/extent
一個人 (alone, one person)

verses.text: 正好有一個祭司，從那條路下來，看見他，就從旁邊走過去了。

words.note: A religious official who performs sacred rites.
Used for long, thin objects like roads or rivers.

words.definition: to see, to catch sight of

verses.text: 又有一個利未人，來到那裡，看見他，也照樣從旁邊走過去了。

words.note: A member of the tribe of Levi, serving in the temple.

words.definition: to see, to catch sight of

verses.text: 只有一個撒瑪利亞人，旅行來到他那裡，看見了，就動了憐憫的心，

words.note: A native or inhabitant of Samaria, often disdained by Jews.

words.definition: to see, to catch sight of

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts for deep sympathy.

verses.text: 上前用油和酒倒在他的傷處，包裹好了，把他扶上自己的牲口，帶他到客店裡照顧他。

words.note: Refers to animals used for transport or labor.

words.definition: to care for, to look after

verses.text: 第二天，他拿出兩個銀幣交給店主，說：『請你照顧他，額外的開支，我回來的時候必還給你。』

words.note: Used before measure words, unlike '二' (èr).

words.definition: to care for, to look after

words.note: Forms a temporal phrase 'when I come back'.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 你想，這三個人，誰是那個落在強盜手中的人的鄰舍呢？」

words.note: More formal than 鄰居 (línjū).

verses.text: 他說：「是那憐憫他的。」耶穌說：「你去，照樣作吧。」

words.note: Common in religious contexts, especially for divine mercy.

verses.text: 他們走路的時候，耶穌進了一個村莊。有一個名叫馬大的女人，接他到家裡。
verses.heading: Jesus and Martha

verses.text: 她有一個妹妹，名叫馬利亞，坐在主的腳前聽道。

words.note: Refers to Jesus or God in Christian contexts.
Implies a position of reverence or learning.

words.definition: listen to teaching, hear the word
words.note: Refers to hearing the teachings of Christ or the Gospel.

verses.text: 馬大被許多要作的事，弄得心煩意亂，就上前來，說：「主啊，我妹妹讓我一個人侍候，你不理嗎？請吩咐她來幫助我。」

words.note: Literally 'heart annoyed, mind confused'.
Respectful address for Jesus.
To attend to someone as a servant or host.

verses.text: 主回答她：「馬大，馬大，你為許多事操心忙碌，

words.note: Refers to Jesus in this context.
Lit. 'handle one's heart'.

verses.text: 但是最需要的只有一件，馬利亞已經選擇了那上好的分，是不能從她奪去的。」

words.note: Turns a phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'what is needed'.
Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Literally 'superior good'.
Connects a modifier to a noun.
Forms a descriptive phrase, often emphasizing what precedes it in '是...的' structure.
